body: We now accept both big and little endian nospams in friend requests so that regardless of how the nospam was presented to the user, we'll accept it. This also fixes the bug that actual big endian systems could never do a successful friend request to begin with. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/269)

comment_regular_data.body: --- Reviewed 1 of 2 files at r1, 1 of 1 files at r2. Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, all discussions resolved. --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/269#-:-KWUylxgwZP7E-ondkFJ:b-jbsf8z)_

Reviewed 1 of 2 files at r1.
Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 2 unresolved discussions.

---

_[toxcore/friend_requests.c, line 130 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/269#-KWUyNz-ZdRqMtzL3Rcx:-KWUyNz-ZdRqMtzL3Rcy:b-481mfg) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/c0a29e9dc853d16d418f532b8f305c4385d0aedc/toxcore/friend_requests.c#L130)):_

> ``` C
>     uint32_t reversed_nospam = htonl(fr->nospam);
>     if (memcmp(packet, &fr->nospam, sizeof(fr->nospam)) != 0
>         && memcmp(packet, &reversed_nospam, sizeof(reversed_nospam)) != 0) {
> ```

These memcpm`s would check`packet`against`fr->nospam` in network byte order twice, if ran on a big-endian cpu (since the original fr->nospam would be big endian to begin with and calling htonl() on it is a no-op).

---

Previously, nurupo wrote… > Here you have change the endianess of nospam returned by the `tox_self_get_address()` function, but the public API has more function that deal with nospam, like `tox_self_get_nospam()` and `tox_self_set_nospam()`. It would be weird if `tox_self_get_address()` suddenly starts returning nospam in one endianess and `tox_self_get_nospam()` in another. >

commit.message:
Return big endian nospam in friend addresses.

We now accept both big and little endian nospams in friend requests so
that regardless of how the nospam was presented to the user, we'll
accept it. This also fixes the bug that actual big endian systems could
never do a successful friend request to begin with.

Return big endian nospam in friend addresses.

We now accept both big and little endian nospams in friend requests so
that regardless of how the nospam was presented to the user, we'll
accept it. This also fixes the bug that actual big endian systems could
never do a successful friend request to begin with.
